definition: tied up in a bundle on a high shelf/to put sth on the back burner/no longer a high priority
to bind/bunch/bundle/classifier for bunches, bundles, beams of light etc/to control

sentences.english: The  selfish man put himself on the  shelf.
sentences.chinese: 那個自私的人把自己束之高閣。

sentences.english: I steeled myself against thoughts of my father.
sentences.chinese: 我把和父親有關的想法都束之高閣。

sentences.english: We'll have to put this conspiracy theory back on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我們得把陰謀論束之高閣了。

sentences.english: But being pigeonholed as a gay film actor is kind of weird for me.
sentences.chinese: 但作爲一個同志電影演員是很怪的我束之高閣。

sentences.english: Various proposals to fix the deficit look set to gather dust (see article).
sentences.chinese: 各種解決赤字問題的提案看上去將束之高閣。

sentences.english: and you're just ready to throw it all to the floor and forget about it.
sentences.chinese: 你們已經準備就此打住，把這事束之高閣了。

sentences.english: I hope this time they will not put my plan on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 希望這一次他們不會把我的計劃束之高閣。

sentences.english: The idea of a short project with 15 photographs was rapidly shelved.
sentences.chinese: 只有15張照片的簡短計劃這種想法很快被束之高閣。

definition: lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to break a code/to crack a riddle/to solve an enigma/a breakthrough
unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
